alert.note: Alert for Caddo (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 07 at 8:38AM CDT until June 08 at 12:28AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Oklahoma, northwest Oklahoma, southwest Oklahoma and western Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, Canadian and Grady. In northwest Oklahoma, Blaine. In southwest Oklahoma, Caddo. In western Oklahoma, Custer and Washita. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 838 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Western Oklahoma City, El Reno, Weatherford, Clinton, Yukon, Hinton, Union City, Minco, Geary, Hydro, Arapaho, Binger, Verden, Calumet, Corn, Custer City, Eakly, Gracemont, Butler and Lookeba. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
